ModuleDescription: Earth Systems Science is an integrated discipline that has been rapidly developing over the last two decades. This module explores the Earth Systems Science discipline by investigating the important bio-geo-physical processes of the couple air-land-ocean system. The following major themes will be examined, with greater focus placed in specialisation area of the lecturer(s): Evolution of the Earth; Transfers of energy and materials; Biochemical cycling; and Linkage of all processes, the influence of humans, and the global change.
Prerequisite: Cohort 2011 and before: Completed at least 80MCs, including 28MCs in GE, Cohort 2012 onwards: Completed at least 80MCs, including 28MCs in GE, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track. Cohort 2012 onwards: (BES students from both specialisations). Completed 80 MCs of NUS modules before they can read any level-4000 GE modules. Do not need to complete 28 MCs of GE modules before they can read any level-4000 GE modules. Do not need a minimum CAP of 3.20 before they can read any level-4000 GE modules.
